p: The novel SARS-CoV-2 belongs to the Betacoronavirus genus of the Coronaviridae family, which are single-stranded RNA viruses [ 2]. Genetic similarity analyses revealed that the bat coronavirus RaTG13 showed the highest similarity (96%) to SARS-CoV-2, and it was suggested that the zoonotic origin might include bats [ 3, 4]. Coronaviruses were thought to result in seasonal mild respiratory illness in humans until the epidemics of the SARS-CoV in 2003 and MERS-CoV in 2012 [ 5, 6].
